comment: She isn't terrible but my problem with her is that her practice exams didn't really help for the exam, the study guides were vague, and she had moments where she'll sound irritated because of somebody asking a question on something they didn't understand too well….if you take her class i recommend taking easy classes alongside with it
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Mrs. Cooper was a great professor, can be challenging if you don't go to class, but if you go to class and actually pay attention, it is super easy to pass. She provided weekly homework's on mastering and had 4 exams total all multiple choice. This class is not for memorization, you really need to understand the concepts and be able to apply them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Respected

comment: Very kind professor!! BUT the course itself can be difficult so please study everyday because there is A LOT of material especially after unit 1. Just memorizing certain things are not going to cut it- you'll have to really understand the information being taught and apply it to the exams (which makes up most of your grade).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: pretty nice ! pe prepared to study test aren't too bad just study and you'll be fine

She make sure that everyone understands the lab before you start it and is very helpful during the lab. You have pre and post lab quizzes that are not hard as long as you read the lab manual. She is kinda of picky on the lab notebook, but you can ask her for feedback on the entry before turning it in. I would take her again in the future!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: She is a great professor! I had her at 8 am and going to class was hard, but its worth it. If you go to class and do her study guides she post you will do good on the test. She can have an attitude sometimes, but she is willing to answer any questions that you have for her.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Her score should be much higher. She was a great teacher for difficult concepts. Her tests are hard, so you absolutely need to study to get the grade you want. I didn't find her off-putting like other reviews, she was very willing to answer questions we had. Easily accessible via email. Take her!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: broooooo, I passed by a thin line. She's so boring and it's crazy on how she only offers 1 test retake. half of the class was failing until the retake
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Dr Cooper runs an easy genetics lab! You have to write a lab notebook in class every week, a midterm, a final group project, and an optional final. She lectures clearly and only includes and emphasizes what is important. My only complaint is that she is often blunt and sometimes codescending when you ask for help or clarification.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures

comment: I feel like this class is an easy A I just got lazy. If you go to lectures and engage and listen, you will do good on the tests. She has in class assignments (3-4 questions quizzes on d2L) that you can work with people on and she gives 4 tests with the option to retake your lowest test. Just show up and you will get an A. An A is also an 88.5-100%.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Dr. Cooper is complicated, one week she'll be nice and want to help then the next she'll be very blunt and make you feel stupid its confusing. This made everyone intimidated to speak. She was very rude to the class and often insulted us. I liked the lab cause it was easy and she explained everything BUT her attitude made me not wanna show up.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: Got an A but js do NOT take her bro, puts down other students badly when they try to reach out for help. If you want your confidence lowered then she's good

I took her for both Genetics and lab. She is very good teacher, but you have to read outside call too. Ninja nerd on YouTube has really good videos. And also utilize her practice exams. They are really helpful.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: i wish i could take dr. cooper for every bio class! she posts powerpoints, practice quizzes, and textbook reading guides. also, the homework she assigns comes directly from what we learned in class. her lectures are easy to understand if you do the readings beforehand; you're going to have to work for your grade, but she will help you if you ask!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I absolutely adore Professor Cooper, if I could have her for all of my classes for the rest of college I would be a happy student. The class itself can be kind of challenging just because of the length of lecture, but the material is not hard to learn. She leaves plenty of time for questions and the environment she creates is welcoming.
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy--Accessible outside class

comment: Favorite lab prof Ive taken! She was clear and concise with lecture before lab. I was never lost. Gen Lab is a lot of fun! Notebook was lowkey and easy to do. Pre and post quizzes easy. She is direct when answering questions which can come off a bit rude, but she doesnt mean it that way. An A is very achievable! I hope to take her again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: I took her for both lab and lecture (but I never went to lecture). She posts all her PowerPoints, which has the exact material you need to understand for the exams. She also gives practice exams that are similar to exams. Provides a lot of resources to help understand the course. Allows 1 retake exam at the end.
rating_tags: Test heavy

comment: Taken her for Genetics and Cell bio, now the tests are not easy but if you grasp the material which she provides in a digestible manner then youll do fine. Take notes and pay attention. She will help you if you have questions and the class has flow and follows the text. Some test questions were hard but if you attended youll do fine. 10/10
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Dr. Cooper is by far the best biology teacher i've taken. she explains things so clearly, and makes the topics seem super easy. she is extremely caring and wants her students to succeed. an 88.5 is considered an A, and she gives extra credit that will boost your grade 1%! Rewatch lectures to study, and you will do great! tests are straightforward.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: its nearly impossible to pass her exams bc of how hard she grades them. i thought i was the only one struggling in that class, but turns out everyone in my class was LOL.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: The content itself is hard but she made it a bit better when it comes to understanding the material. You definitely need to attend lectures and work for the grade. There are sometimes small quizzes during class. She makes a practice test for each exam and so far they have been close to the exam so they helped a lot. Book is not necessary but helps.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Not the best professor. Does not answer questions fully or answers condescendingly. The class and lab werent that bad but she makes it harder. No one in my class got an A on the lab practical which cost me an A. I would recommend taking a different professional.

Unfortunately had her for both lecture and lab. 100% avoid for lab, creates a hostile environment with an OVERWHELMING amount of work for 1 credit hour. Her lecture was alright but I recommend taking somebody else. Her classes are easy but I slacked in lecture and got a B which was all on me. 4 exams with 1 retake, and LOADS of homework. Just dont
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Grade comes from 4 exams and homework. You will have homework EVERY DAY, no questions asked, without fail. They're not hard at all, so just make sure you do them. Any assignment given will be for a grade, so do them all. And she does come off a little standoffish when you ask questions in class though :/. Dr. Cooper does mean well tho!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Coopers lab was easy in the sense that there were multiple attempts for pre and post quizzes and they were pretty straight forward. However, she wasnt my original professor and I was rude from day one. If you dared ask a question youd pretty much always get a rude or condescending answer. She made me feel uncomfortable for 3 hours of my day
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Cooper is a good lecturer, but can have an attitude when asked questions. A LOT of Pearson homework before EVERY CLASS. Practice tests help a lot with the actual tests. You MUST know your stuff in order to past the class. Five exams (including the final). One discussion post. Several practice tests.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: So genetics is not an easy class. Dr. Cooper can teach well and explain it well, but you really really gotta put in an effort to make an A in this class. No cumulative exams. Lots of homework. Do the practice tests! Do everything that she provides; that's probably your way to succeed in this class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Cooper is amazing for genetics lab! Her pre-lab lectures are the best I have experienced out of every lab I have been in. She actually made this lab fun! This was the first lab I ever was excited to attend. Gives practice tests that greatly prepare you for the 4 lab exams. Some assignments for credit. Great lab and great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Cooper was an amazing professor. Genetics is a thorough course, but if you put in the time, you will make an A. No curveballs on tests. Study topics cover exactly what you need to know for exams. Lots of graded assignments. Great at explaining course material in an understandable way. 5 tests with optional "final" test retake to replace lowest.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Very lecture heavy and is snappy when you ask her a question. Homework due for every class, practice tests, and tests every two weeks. She hates repeating herself and can get aggressive. Takes polls during class for participation and gives a little extra credit at the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Cooper is an all-around great professor for lab. She explained the procedure well enough in lab so that you didnt need to read beforehand; unless it was one of the final labs. Optional final exam. Given 4 tests. 4 practice tests for each. If you do well on the practice tests, youll do well on the actual tests. Wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor! She is very helpful and understanding. Attendance is mandatory and labs are pretty straight forward if you just read the labs and do what she asks of you
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Cell biology can seem tough but Professor Cooper's lectures help mitigate the intensity of the material. She has clear outlines of what you need to know for tests and doesn't really throw curveballs on the material. While some say she can come off as condescending, she still does her best to answer everyone's questions and provide any information.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Cooper made cell bio an easy class. Her questions are straight forward and check to see whether you understand concepts and can apply them rather than memorize information. Few test questions come from the homework, so it helps to cover them before the test. Go through the textbook and make sure you understand the concept thoroughly for an A.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Dr. Cooper is an excellent professor. She is extremely understanding and is willing to help her students. She lectures heavy. Her exams are multiple-choice questions and short answers. She definitely does a good job of engaging her students and tries to use different study strategies to help her students understand the cell.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Not a good professor at all, treats you very condescendingly and doesn't let you answer questions at all. Save yourself and do not take this class or any class with her.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: I have had Professor Cooper at Kennesaw State for genetics and cell bio. She is a good professor, but you HAVE to come to lecture to be successful. She's not the multiple choice memorization professor. Her tests are based on case studies and examples you have to be in class to know. Lab techniques are also very important on tests
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Dr. Cooper is really nice and she will work with you. The class is tough and you have to put in the time to study. Her test are fair very detailed so again make sure you study but overall great person, great professor!

Professor Cooper is a good professor, but she's too smart that it feels like she can't dumb things down for you. The class itself is not super difficult but definitely do not take with the intention of it being an "easy" class. You will have to read and put in a lot of effort. This class is basically Bio 2 but expanded and with A LOT more detail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Cooper is wonderful. Her class is tough, but if you study (powerpoints, book chapters, homework) you will get an A. It's really important to review diagrams and understand processes. But she teaches clearly, and she has always been nice and understanding to me. Hard exams, but I learned a lot.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Study hard for both the midterm and final. Also, it helps to ask for clarification about the lab report rubrics since those are a big chunk of your grade.
rating_tags: TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tough Grader

comment: Extremely rude and arrogant. She is very sharp tongued and ill-mannered with repossesses to questions students ask. If you need help don't ask her, ask another professor. I don't know how she is with lectures, but if she's like this in a 1 credit class I cant imagine a lecture class. So far worst teacher I ever had, would never take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: She is rude and would criticize my work and question. If I asked her a question she would not help and instead criticize my work even though I came to class to learn. I'm not a biologist so it's obvious I would make mistakes in labs and have questions, and her job is to guide and help me understand which she did none of that.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Trash. Absolutely terrible!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Overall she is a terrible teacher. The Labs were not too bad but her attitude was awful. If you have questions about any of the labs or assignments she treats you like you are a moron and you should know everything. She is very rude. Her test has a lot of fill in the blank and the multiple choice is a little difficult. Studying a lot for the tests.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She is extremely smart, but she answers your questions as if you are a moron. I am doing very well and will make an A, but your grades seem to be based on how she's feeling. Her reasoning isn't clear for mark offs, and differ from assignment to assignment. I would take her for lab if you're not going slack off. Wouldn't take her for lecture.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Lectures throughout the entire class period off of a powerpoint. There a four tests that make 78% of your grade, participation and homework make the other 22%. She probably is a great person outside of school, but answers questions degradingly.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: She closes homework assignment after a couple days. Her exams are pretty straight forward but her wording was confusing on a couple of the exams. She takes attendance! She's quite rude and will talk to you like you're stupid if you talk to her outside of class. Her lectures aren't horrible but her attitude makes me not recommend her.
rating_tags: Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Great professor, super nice and very helpful. Gives lots of chances in class to ask Qs. Goes over each topic thoroughly to make sure you understand. I read the chapters, but some people only use her ppts and do fine on the tests. Easy B if you study. Would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.
